column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  March 23 Ratings agency Standard and Poor's said on Monday it maintained its BBB- rating for Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras but revised its outlook to negative from stable  reflecting the challenges the company faces in funding its plans to increase production.

column5: Pfizer Inc and Eli Lilly and Co will resume  late-stage studies of their drug tanezumab for chronic pain after the U.S. Food and Drug Administration lifted a partial hold on trials of it and similar medicines.

column4: UPDATE 2-Pfizer  Lilly to resume study testing pain drug

column4: U.S. bank regulators say RBS  BNP  HSBC living wills fall short
column5: WASHINGTON  March 23 The U.S. Federal Reserve and the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. on Monday criticized plans by three foreign banks to go through ordinary bankruptcy in times of crisis.

column4: New RBS chairman defends his record as regulator
column5: LONDON Incoming Royal Bank of Scotland Chairman Howard Davies has defended his role in setting up the financial regulator that presided over the near meltdown of Britain's banking system.

column4: RBS to sell $3 billion more Citizens shares to cut stake to less than half
column5: LONDON Royal Bank of Scotland  is to sell up to $3.3 billion more shares in its U.S. bank Citizens  to cut its stake to less than half and accelerate its retreat to its home UK market.

column4: UPDATE 1-RBS to sell $3 bln more Citizens shares to cut stake to less than half

column4: RBS announces further share sale in US arm Citizens
column5: LONDON  March 23 Royal Bank of Scotland  is to sell up to another 132 million shares in its U.S. bank Citizens to cut its stake to less than half.

column4: Bristol  Sanofi and Novartis drugs to shine among 2015 launches
column5: LONDON Bristol-Myers Squibb  Sanofi and Novartis have the three top new drugs set to reach the market in 2015  among 11 products each with $1 billion-plus sales potential  according to a Thomson Reuters analysis.

column5: The U.S. shale oil industry may have forever abandoned its heavy-spending ways in the face of sliding crude prices  Schlumberger Ltd   the world's No.1 oilfield services provider  said on Monday.

column4: Humana to sell Concentra medical center unit for $1 billion
column5: NEW YORK Health insurer Humana Inc  said on Monday that it would sell its Concentra urgent care and physical therapy services unit for about $1 billion to private equity firm Welsh  Carson  Anderson & Stowe and Select Medical Holdings Corp .

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Energy  mining shares push TSX higher
column5: TORONTO  March 23 Canada's main stock index advanced on Monday with shares of energy companies climbing on higher oil prices and miners getting a lift from stronger copper prices.

column4: Hutchison and Telefonica set to close O2 deal for $15.7 billion: FT
column5: Hutchison Whampoa Ltd  is expected to finalize a deal to buy Telefonica SA's  British mobile unit O2 for 10.5 billion pounds ($15.70 billion) as early as Tuesday morning  the Financial Times reported.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: March 23 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Monday:

column4: Tenet in deal to create largest outpatient surgery provider
column5: Tenet Healthcare Corp  on Monday said it would become the largest U.S. provider of outpatient surgery services through a joint venture with United Surgical Partners International and expects to fully own the company within five years. |Â Video

column4: UPDATE 3-Tenet in deal to create largest outpatient surgery provider
column5: March 23 Tenet Healthcare Corp on Monday said it would become the largest U.S. provider of outpatient surgery services through a joint venture with United Surgical Partners International and expects to fully own the company within five years.

column4: Tenet  United Surgical to form joint venture for $1.9 bln
column5: March 23 Hospital operator Tenet Healthcare Corp  said it would form a joint venture with United Surgical Partners International in a cash and debt transaction valued at $1.93 billion to be the largest provider of ambulatory surgery in the United States.

column4: Tenet near deal to buy United Surgical for more than $2.5 billion: WSJ
column5: NEW YORK Hospital operator Tenet Healthcare Corp is poised to buy United Surgical Partners International Inc in a deal that could be worth more than $2.5 billion  the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Tenet near deal to buy United Surgical for more than $2.5 bln-WSJ
column5: NEW YORK  March 22 Hospital operator Tenet Healthcare Corp is poised to buy United Surgical Partners International Inc in a deal that could be worth more than $2.5 billion  the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Honda hires U.S. engineering firm Exponent to probe Takata air bags
column5: TOKYO Honda Motor Co  has hired Exponent  a U.S.-based engineering consulting company enlisted by Toyota Motor Corp  during its recall crisis in 2010  to investigate the cause of ruptures in some air bags made by Takata Corp .

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: March 23 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Monday:

column4: UPDATE 1-Zijin Mining to acquire stake in Friedland's Ivanhoe Mines
column5: TORONTO  March 23 China's Zijin Mining Group   is set to buy a 9.9 percent stake in Ivanhoe Mines Ltd for about C$105 million ($83.77 million) and is in "detailed" talks on jointly developing Ivanhoe's copper project in central Africa  the two companies said on Monday.

column4: SEC to allow shareholder vote on Wal-Mart independent chairman
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc shareholders will vote in June at the company's annual meeting on electing an independent board chairman  after U.S. regulators rejected a request by the retailer to block the proposal.

column4: UPDATE 1-Whiting Petroleum to offer 35 mln shares to reduce debt
column5: WILLISTON  N.D.  March 23 Whiting Petroleum Corp   the largest North Dakota oil producer  said on Monday it would sell 35 million shares of common stock to help pare debt from its December buyout of rival Kodiak Oil & Gas.

column4: Whiting Petroleum to offer 35 million shares to reduce debt
column5: WILLISTON  N.D.  March 23 Whiting Petroleum Corp   the largest North Dakota oil producer  said on Monday it would sell 35 million shares of common stock to help cull its $5.63 billion debt load.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. developing bird flu vaccine  no distribution plans yet
column5: CHICAGO  March 23 The U.S. government is developing a vaccine to protect poultry from new strains of avian flu that have recently killed birds from Arkansas to Washington state.

column4: U.S. Supreme Court rejects singer Rundgren's Chase suit appeal
column5: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to revive a lawsuit by singer-songwriter Todd Rundgren and his wife Michele accusing JPMorgan Chase of wrongfully attempting to foreclose on the couple's Kilauea  Hawaii home.
